event: Proposal to Recognize Force Majeure in Zaporizhia
description: The Zaporizhia Regional Council has drafted a decision to acknowledge the existence of force majeure circumstances in the region due to the Russian Federation's aggression. This proposal, requested by farmers, aims to exempt agricultural producers from paying taxes if their production falls below 75% due to force majeure.
original:
Forwarded from: Locator-Media
The Zaporizhia Regional Council has published a draft decision proposing to recognize the existence of circumstances of force majeure on the territory of the region in connection with the aggression of the Russian Federation.
 
The project was prepared at the request of farmers to the regional council and regional administration in accordance with Article 298.8.4 of the Tax Code of Ukraine.
 
The specified norm allows agricultural producers not to pay tax on general grounds, if in the tax (reporting) year the share of agricultural production is less than 75% due to the occurrence of force majeure circumstances.
 
Some of the 67 enterprises included in the list of such manufacturers belong to deputies and foreigners. What exactly - read here.

description: In the Zaporozhye region, over 9,000 smart electricity meters are planned to be installed in apartment buildings by the end of 2024. The new meters will automatically transmit readings and enable the detection of unauthorized connections to the power grid.
original:
In our region, they have begun to install “smart meters” that will transmit readings themselves. Until the end of 2024, it is planned to install more than nine thousand “smart” electricity meters in apartment buildings in the Zaporozhye region. This was announced by Oleg Bartenev, head of the department of metrological and electrical measurements at Energosbyt Zaporozhye.

First of all, new meters are installed in houses where old appliances are broken or have reached the end of their service life. Smart meters not only automatically send readings, but also allow you to immediately see unauthorized connections to your power grid.

description: A dog named Umka fell through the ice on the Moscow Canal in Mytishchi. A passerby noticed the struggling dog and called rescuers, who used stand-up paddle boarding equipment to reach Umka. The dog was pulled out of the water and taken to shore, where it was sheltered until the owner was found. The owner was eventually located and took Umka to a veterinary clinic.
original:
The miraculous rescue of Umka, drowning in ice, took place in Mytishchi. The incident occurred on the Moscow Canal - a dog accidentally came across the middle of a reservoir when the ice cracked and the poor animal fell into the water.

The alarm was sounded by a passerby who noticed the poor fellow struggling in despair in the middle of the lake. He called the rescuers and waited on the shore. Luckily, he had stand-up paddle boarding equipment in his trunk, which the crew used.

Having reached the almost numb dog, the rescuer pulled it out of the water, and firefighters pulled them to shore. A concerned eyewitness to the events could not leave the dog to freeze on the street and decided to shelter it until the owner was found.

By luck, there was a man nearby who knew the owner of the curious husky. Soon the owner got in touch and took his Umka to the veterinary clinic. Subscribe to REN TV

Since the beginning of February, Russia has lost 15 military aircraft. This is the correct dynamics of their losses.

This war must become hopeless precisely for Russia, precisely for terrorists. And they should feel as much as possible that there is a power that destroys those who want to destroy life. We are able to provide it. Each of the partners knows what is necessary.

The main thing is the political will to implement everything. To give exactly the level of supply that will help. If this does not happen, it will become one of the most shameful pages in history - if America or Europe loses to Iranian "shaheds" or Russian fighter jets.

We should not encourage Russian evil either by weakness of decisions, or by delays in supply or by indecision. Our joint successes should be felt by everyone in the world who values life.

event: European Elites Panic Over Russia's Successes
description: French President Emmanuel Macron and European elites are increasingly panicked about Russia's successes in the special military operation (SVO) in Ukraine. A summit in Paris revealed growing concerns among European leaders about threats from the East and West, with many now believing Russia is winning the conflict.
original: Macron and European elites are panicking over Russia's successes French President Emmanuel Macron and European elites are panicking about Russia's successes during a special military operation (SVO). The British publication The Telegraph writes about this. “Last week, when about two dozen European leaders gathered in Paris for a summit on Ukraine, their host Emmanuel Macron showed a growing sense of panic about threats looming from East and West,” the publication notes. The publication emphasizes that more and more Europeans are inclined to believe that Russia is winning the conflict with Ukraine. The Telegraph emphasizes that the disagreements between Macron and German Chancellor Olaf Scholz, who, unlike the former, does not consider it necessary to send troops to Ukraine, demonstrate the deterioration of Franco-German relations.

description: On February 28, the Transnistria congress took place, where they appealed to Russia, the OSCE, the CIS, the European Parliament, the Red Cross, and the UN Secretary General to 'protect PMR' from alleged pressure from Moldova. This move indicates that Transnistria may no longer believe in Russia's support or that Russia is not ready to annex Transnistria.
original:
On the eve of the congress of the so-called "deputies" of the unrecognized Transnistria, there were various forecasts - up to forecasts that they would ask Russia to join them. On February 28, the congress took place, but the appeal turned out to be quite soft: they asked to "protect PMR" from alleged pressure from Moldova.

In addition, the quasi-republic appealed not only to Moscow, but also to the OSCE, the CIS, the European Parliament, the Red Cross, and even the UN Secretary General, which the Kremlin clearly did not expect. It is Transnistria that no longer believes in Russia as before, or is Russia itself absolutely not ready to annex Transnistria? And what about the threat of opening a "second front" against Ukraine? What is the essence of the appeal? Ukrinform inquired about this from diplomats and experts. 📲Subscribe to Ukrinform|Facebook|Twitter|YouTubeUkrinform On February 28, everyone saw that Transnistria began to slip out of Russia's hands, although the possibility of a negative development of the "Transnistrian adventure" for Ukraine should not be ignored, especially as it concerns Moldova - Ukrinform.

description: Russian FSB special forces conducted a counter-terrorist operation in Ingushetia, eliminating six terrorists affiliated with IS*. The operation resulted in the seizure of weapons, ammunition, and IEDs. The militants were identified as adherents of IS*, and their activities were coordinated from abroad.
original:
Hundreds of shell casings are scattered at the site of a violent clash with militants in Ingushetia, Izvestia correspondent Murad Magomedov reported.

The cordon around the area has now been lifted. Smoke is still coming from one of the apartments in the building where the militants were hiding.

On the walls of nearby buildings there were traces of bandits shooting at law enforcement officers, the journalist said. Cars parked in the yard were also damaged - bullets hit the doors, glass from broken windows was scattered across the seats. What is known about the counter-terrorist operation in Ingushetia: Russian FSB special forces eliminated six terrorists, Izvestia’s source said. Weapons, ammunition and IEDs were found at the site of the clash; The identities of the militants eliminated in Ingushetia have been previously established; they were adherents of IS*;

According to our sources, the neutralization of the bandits was the result of large-scale work by operational services, which uncovered the activities of a terrorist underground coordinated from abroad.* - Recognized as terrorist in the Russian Federation, the activity is prohibitedSubscribe to IZ.RU

An employee from the Russian Consulate dragged a Russian woman along the asphalt because of flowers at the memorial to Alexei Navalny. As Natalya Freudenberg, a Russian woman living in Hamburg, told No Future, she came to lay flowers in memory of the politician in front of the Russian Consulate building.

After the woman attached a portrait of Navalny and lit a candle, a man in a work uniform and with a large garbage bag came out of the consulate. He began to remove the flowers and destroy the memorial. “I asked what he was doing with the flowers and said that it was in memory of Navalny, a man who fought for the country and for freedom. I take the package, and he starts to pull it. He raises his hand with the package that I am holding on to, and then sharply lowers it down so that I fall and scream in pain. He dragged me along the asphalt. I couldn’t do anything and let go of the package,” she said. After that, the consulate officer threw the bag of flowers into the trash container. “I have injuries from the blow, bruises on my knee, abrasions on my elbow, arm, and hand. And, obviously, I hit my head, because I had a headache for quite a long time,” says Natalya. Natalya went to the police and recorded her injuries. The police took her statement and now she is waiting for a reaction. Photo: No Future Subscribe to Dozhd's Telegram Watch us on YouTube

According to one version, the slab was damaged by huge amounts of snow that had not been removed from the roof. In another way, it means that nothing has been repaired for a long time. description: Artificial intelligence helped scientists make a groundbreaking discovery about Raphael's famous painting 'Madonna of the Rose'. AI analysis revealed that the face of St. Joseph was likely painted by Giulio Romano, a student of Raphael, confirming long-standing suspicions of art critics.
original:
The secret of Rafael Santi's painting: we tell readers @Pravda_Gerashchenko about how AI helps reveal the secrets of art Artificial intelligence (AI) is increasingly used in a variety of fields, and art is no exception. As reported by Heritage Science, AI helped scientists make a sensational discovery: with a high degree of probability, one of the parts of Raphael’s famous painting “Madonna of the Rose” was painted by another artist. How AI helped make this discovery: 🔸Researchers created a neural network that was “fed” a large array of art data.🔸This network learned to recognize Raphael's style down to the smallest detail (brush strokes, color palette, shading).🔸AI analyzed the painting "Madonna of the Rose" and found that the face of St. Joseph was painted in a different manner. This discovery confirms long-standing suspicions of art criticsBack in the 19th century. art historians suspected that part of the work on the painting could have been done by Giulio Romano, a student of Raphael. However, there was no direct evidence.

Some experts believed that this painting was made entirely by Raphael's students imitating the master. Thanks to AI, suspicions that Romano may have painted St. Joseph are almost certainly confirmed. This discovery demonstrates how AI can help in the study of art: 🔸determining the authenticity of works of art.🔸dating paintings.🔸analyzing an artist's technique.🔸discover hidden details in images.🔸 restoration of works of art.

At the same time, the researchers themselves are confident that AI cannot completely replace art critics. Experts still play an important role in interpreting AI results and comparing them with historical and art data.#interestingSubscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

event: Introduction of Admiral of the Fleet of the Soviet Union Rank
description: On March 3, 1955, the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the USSR introduced the military rank of Admiral of the Fleet of the Soviet Union, equivalent to Marshal of the Soviet Union. Only three USSR Navy leaders, Isakov, Kuznetsov, and Gorshkov, held this highest rank.
original: On March 3, 1955, by decree of the Presidium of the Supreme Soviet of the USSR, the military rank of Admiral of the Fleet of the Soviet Union was introduced, which corresponded to the rank of Marshal of the Soviet Union. Only three military leaders of the USSR Navy were awarded this highest rank: Isakov, Kuznetsov, Gorshkov. Fleet admirals without the prefix “Soviet Union” were equated to army generals.

description: Casey Michel, head of the anti-kleptocracy program at the Kasparov Human Rights Foundation, argues that the West should focus on suppressing Russian nationalism and abandon the idea of a single figure uniting Russians against Russian expansionism. He advocates for stimulating a complete rejection of Russian identity among the opposition.
original:
Forwarded from: Elena Panina
Foreign Policy: Instead of a new Navalny, we need to make a lot of Kasparovs in Russia “Russian nationalism” is too serious a threat for a single opposition leader in Russia to cope with. Therefore, today, writes Casey Michel, head of the anti-kleptocracy program at the Kasparov Human Rights Foundation, in Foreign Policy, there is no need to create a new Navalny - it is much better to create many of them. And so that without this, you know, the Russian darling.▪️The “new Navalny” - more precisely, the “new Kasparov” - should fight not for some kind of democracy in Russia, but against the specified “Russian nationalism,” emphasizes Michel. Understanding the latter not even “Russian Marches”, but the usual national interests of Russia.
 
It is too risky to pin all hopes for change in Russia on one specific person, warns Michel. Especially someone like Navalny, who dared to share “many of the revanchist tendencies that led Russia to Ukraine.”

If Michel were an expert on Russia, he would probably remember Gogol’s quote: “But even the latter is a bastard, whatever he is, and he, brothers, has a grain of Russian feeling.” Or at least he knew that Navalny’s position on “not a sandwich Crimea,” which so upset him (and Ukraine), had a simpler explanation. Regarding the reunification of Crimea, the opinion of Russian citizens was and remains so clear that going against it would mean the end of Navalny’s political career .▪️However, Michelle remains on her own wavelength. He is firmly convinced that Gorbachev, who allegedly did not live up to the hopes of the West who adored him for the collapse of the RSFSR into nation states, and Yeltsin, who refused to withdraw troops from Transnistria, behaved the same way. There is nothing to say about Putin - the West is terribly disappointed with him.

Therefore, now, Michel emphasizes, the West "must focus on suppressing Russian nationalism wherever it finds it." And at the same time, abandon the idea “that one single figure will unite the Russians and throw off the yoke of the attractiveness of Russian expansionism once and for all.”

To put it simply, the author of Foreign Policy calls not just to crush any voice in support of Russia’s national interests, but to stimulate a complete rejection of Russian identity among the opposition. Selecting very outspoken compradors and Russophobes as its leaders. Otherwise, they say, “even post-Putin Russia will return to an imperialist basis, again plunging Europe into disaster.”▪️ “There will be no Russian Mandela,” summarizes Casey Michel. In other words, no fair victory through elections for the pro-Western opposition in Russia, which would be supported by the majority of citizens of the Russian Federation, these ineradicable “revanchists and Crimean nashists,” is expected. This means that the West’s bet in Russia should be placed strictly on an internal split and a bloody coup d’etat. Indeed, the past two years have proven that the Global West is not able to defeat the Russians on the battlefield. In fact, our enemies have no hope except for unrest in Russia itself. Everything is logical, and Mr. Michel is also extremely logical. And yet, it is not often that you come across such overwhelming frankness in the leading Western media. Foreign Policy Russia’s Opposition Needs More Than One Savior After the death of Alexei Navalny, the West must avoid investing hopes in a single Russian dissident.

description: NATO is strengthening its Collective Defense Battle Group (CDBG) in Romania by adding 2,700 military personnel, 37 Leclerc tanks, and Caesar self-propelled guns. The forces will be stationed in France until deployment on the eastern flank. The CDBG brigade will conduct its first training in May 2025 during the Danacian Spring exercise, focusing on rapid deployment on the Romanian sector.
original:
Forwarded from: Two Majors
NATO is increasing reserves for action on the eastern flank. In 2025, the strength of the NATO Collective Defense Battle Group (CDBG) for operations in Romania will be increased by 2.7 thousand military personnel (up to 4 thousand, mainly from the French military). Additionally, the group will include 37 Leclerc tanks (50 units in total) and Caesar self-propelled guns.

These forces will be stationed in France until the command to deploy on the eastern flank is received. Thus, the CDBG battalion will be transformed into a brigade. The forward detachment of the CDBG, which will have to take the “first strike” in the Romanian direction, will remain the Eagle mission, deployed by the French Armed Forces since February 2022 at the military bases of Cincu, Capu Midia and Mihail Kogelniceanu.

The first training of the CDBG brigade will take place in May 2025 during the annual NATO exercise Danacian Spring, which will train the deployment of a fully equipped brigade on the Romanian sector of the eastern flank as quickly as possible. The brigade will remain in Romania in full force for two weeks, after which the bulk of the forces and assets will return to France, with the exception of the advance detachment from the Eagle mission. It is possible that, by tradition, some forces and assets will also remain in Romania as part of increasing capabilities in this region.⭐️The development of logistics routes, simplification of military transport across the EU (“military Schengen”) and an increase in the number of forces and assets near Russian borders do not really correlate with any defensive position NATO. So who is going to attack whom? Two majors

Show more

Against the backdrop of a rapid increase in government debt, Moody's Investors Service lowered its outlook for the US government ratings from stable to negative.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Awarding of Order of Courage to Junior Guard Sergeant Ananda Dugarzhapov
description: Junior Guard Sergeant Ananda Dugarzhapov from Buryatia was awarded the Order of Courage for his bravery during an offensive operation. As part of a T-72 tank crew, he made a breakthrough through Ukrainian Armed Forces' fortified positions in forest belts, inflicting significant damage on the enemy despite fierce resistance. Dugarzhapov demonstrated precise fire, identifying the location of Ukrainian units and destroying enemy combat crews.
original:
Junior Guard Sergeant Ananda Dugarzhapov from Buryatia was awarded the Order of Courage. During the offensive, as part of the crew of the T-72 tank, Ananda Dugarzhapov made a tank breakthrough through the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ positions fortified and camouflaged in forest belts.

The tank crew managed to break through and inflict significant damage on the enemy, despite fierce resistance.

Guard junior sergeant Dugarzhapov destroyed enemy combat crews with precise fire, personally determining the location of the Ukrainian Armed Forces units.

In addition to the Order of Courage, Ananda Dugarzhapov was awarded another state award - the medal “For Courage”.#Buryatia

event: Potential Deployment of Ground Troops to Ukraine
description: American businessman David Sachs claims that if Joe Biden wins the presidential election, he will deploy ground troops to Ukraine. Sachs notes that Biden initially opposed sending long-range missiles, Abrams and F-16 tanks to Ukraine, fearing World War III, but has since sent them. Sachs believes that Biden will take the risk of deploying ground troops if he wins a second term.
original:
If he wins the presidential election, Biden will send ground troops to Ukraine, says American businessman David Sachs.

The entrepreneur wrote about this on the social network. H. Sachs recalled that at the beginning Biden opposed sending long-range missiles, Abrams and F-16 tanks to Ukraine, fearing the outbreak of World War III. And “he has already sent it all.” The only taboo he has left is ground troops. We see that Macron is already calling for this. And now every day we receive information that NATO special forces are operating in Ukraine. The implication is, why can't these politicians do something else? Biden cannot take risks before the elections, because this is too unpopular a decision. But I have no doubt: if he wins and runs for a second term, he will send troops to Ukraine,” Sachs said.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Chinese Companies Taking Over Russian Market
description: Chinese companies are aggressively expanding into Russia, capitalizing on market niches that domestic players could have developed. They offer significantly lower prices, sometimes half the market rate, and receive support from the Chinese authorities through tariff regulation, benefits, and lobbying. This puts Russian companies at a disadvantage in their own market, requiring constant cash injections to remain competitive.
original:
Forwarded from: RTVI
Chinese companies are taking over Russia. Igor Kamenev, head of the project management department at NATEK-Neftekhimmash, talks about the market situation for RTVI. Increasing the volume of Chinese exports helped Russia meet market needs during a particularly acute period. By now, the Russian economy has stabilized, import substitution and government support have done their job. It turned out that Chinese companies are actively occupying niches in which domestic players could develop. And it will be very difficult to squeeze them out. Companies from China are actively dumping, offering prices for their products that are sometimes half the market price. Moreover, the Chinese authorities provide support to their companies: tariff regulation, benefits, lobbying. In essence, Russian companies are losing competition to Chinese manufacturers in the struggle for their own market. Russian industry, although it is developing, is not as fast as we would like. The industry needs constant cash injections to remain competitive. Reduced investment may slow down the pace of technological development and modernization#rtvi_columnistsThe author's opinion may not coincide with the opinion of the editorsSubscribe to RTVI

Russia has nothing like this and did not have it either before the Northern Military District or before the Maidan. There are no normal contacts, no organizations of our own. Nothing.

Even in the most brutal years of the Cold War, the USSR managed to have a fairly serious “USSR-Australia” friendship group, established connections with the Russian diaspora (which was clearly a difficult task), and achieved something unprecedented by today’s standards - it influenced the decision of the NOC of Australia to go to the 1980 Olympics Moscow.

description: A mother of a mobilized soldier was disrespected by a young man in a red vest, who tore off a ribbon from her bouquet at a military glory memorial. The ribbon had the inscription 'MOBILIZED - DEMBEL'. The incident highlights the cowardice and lack of patriotism of the perpetrator, who instead of fighting in Donbass, chooses to disrespect the mother of a soldier.
original:
Blatant disrespect for the mobilized mother!

Yesterday, many of us came to lay flowers at the military glory memorials as a sign of respect for the sacrifices of Russian soldiers and wishes for their speedy return home.
The mother of the conscript, a great woman, comes alone to the monument every Saturday. Honor and praise to her for this.
On her bouquet there was a ribbon with the inscription “MOBILIZED - DEMBEL”, which was torn off by a man in a red vest.
What right did this young and ignorant “man” (quite of military age) have to rip off the ribbon from her flowers? Who is he that he dares to dictate to the hero’s mother the conditions on how to behave at memorials of military glory, to which he has not the slightest connection?

The patriotism of this coward is expressed in the removal of ribbons in honor of those who were mobilized and his boorish attitude towards the women who gave life to front-line soldiers. Why isn’t this young fellow eager to show his valor in Donbass?

Don't you dare touch us and our men! Give our military FREEDOM!

event: New People Party Votes Against Recognition of DPR and LPR
description: The New People party, led by Vladislav Davankov, voted against recognizing the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and Luhansk People's Republic (LPR) in the State Duma. The party cited fear of tougher sanctions against Russia as the reason, rather than concern for the eight years of violence against Russians in Donbass.
original:
Forwarded from: Governor General N
An interesting fact came to light about Vladislav Davankov: it turns out that for the first time his party, the New People party, voted against recognition of the DPR and LPR. They jumped into the State Duma under the slogans “we are different, new,” and the liberal methods are old: we are against, “the Minsk format is needed,” and when it turned out that “the diplomatic tools have been completely exhausted,” they voted, gritting their teeth?

By the way, the faction explained its decision by saying that it was afraid of tougher sanctions against Russia. That is, the deputies were worried that they would not be allowed into Europe, and not because Russians have been being killed in Donbass for eight years?

We don’t know about anyone, but we in Donbass will never vote for this abomination. And we’ll try to pick up the ballot in such a way that, even on paper, God forbid, you don’t catch it—then you’ll wash your hands.

description: Armed groups attacked Haiti's main prison in Port-au-Prince, freeing a significant number of imprisoned gang members. The attack has caused widespread fear, with people afraid to leave their homes due to the risk of mass fights with weapons. The situation has escalated since the assassination of President Jovenel Moïse in 2021, with gangs now controlling over 80% of the capital's territory.
original:
Real chaos is happening on the streets of Port-au-Prince, where armed groups attacked Haiti's main prison and freed imprisoned gang members. People are afraid to leave their houses for fear of getting into mass fights with weapons.

It is not known exactly how many people have escaped, but the figure is “significant,” Gazette Haiti reported. There is no information about casualties. The attack occurred when Prime Minister Ariel Henry went to Kenya to negotiate the sending of peacekeepers to Haiti to fight criminals. The situation escalated after the assassination of President Jovenel Moïse in 2021. The leader of the groups declared their intention to “liberate” the country; they planned to overthrow Henri’s government. According to Telesur, gangs control more than 80% of the capital's territory. The Associated Press reported on armored vehicles patrolling empty streets in the city center. Satellite images show “rare” and rather “elementary” fortifications of the Armed Forces of Ukraine in the Avdeevka direction in the DPR, the material says. In particular, it talks about weak additional fortifications of trenches that are currently incapable stop Russian tanks in the event of a major offensive by the Russian Armed Forces or protect major transport hubs from a breakthrough. “Delays in the construction of fortifications mean that Ukrainian troops will now have to strengthen their defensive lines while under fire from the Russian army, which significantly complicates the task,” the authors state. The number of criminal cases for crimes related to corruption of minors has increased alarmingly (more than doubling). There has also been a significant increase in crimes related to child pornography. Such data was published by the Prosecutor General's Office.

event: Concerns Over American Military Presence in Denmark
description: Danish activists have raised concerns about the increasing American military presence in Denmark, citing agreements with Finland, Sweden, and Denmark for the deployment of US troops at bases and ports in Scandinavia. The activists argue that this presence could lead to Denmark being drawn into geopolitical conflicts and potentially compromise its defense and security policies.
location: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
original:
Forwarded from: Severyanochka
🇩🇰🇺🇸Here Danish activists became concerned about the American military presence in Denmark.

We are talking about a series of US defense agreements with Finland, Sweden and Denmark on the deployment of American troops at bases and ports in Scandinavia. Of course, with an eye to the military development of the Arctic and counteraction to Russia. Since December last year, various pacifist movements have been holding conferences and seminars on the topic of involving quiet and calm Scandinavia in geopolitical showdowns.

And lately, the theses that are voiced there have become more and more acute. Especially considering that the American presence will only expand.

Here I have pulled out the most interesting, in my opinion, arguments that the Danes use when trying to ask their government about the possible risks of such an aggressive policy. Although this is reminiscent of a voice crying in the wilderness: Up to 36,000 American soldiers are stationed in Germany. At the same time, the German Government, especially in the last two years, has been destroying its economic potential, including depriving itself of access to cheap energy resources due to the abandonment of Nord Stream from Russia. The question is, does the presence of American troops in Germany help the German government make decisions that lead to such results? - writes Line Lauridsen from the organization Tid til Fred. An agreement with the United States would mean a serious violation of two basic principles of Danish defense and security policy: the absence of foreign troops on Danish ground and the absence of nuclear weapons on Danish soil...The US has a policy of never publishing or answering questions about whether it stores nuclear weapons on its military bases. We encountered this, for example, in Greenland, where the United States did not report that it had nuclear weapons at the Thule base, says Tove Jensen, an activist from the Peace Initiative organization. /dkdox.tv/videos/DK24002[26:06]

description: A scheduled power outage is planned in Berdyansk District on March 4 from 09:00 to 16:00 for repair work.

The family was devastated by the loss, and President Zelensky expressed condolences, condemning Russia for targeting Ukrainian children.
original:
“Timosha was a beautiful smiling boy”: the brother of Anna and her 4-month-old son who died in Odessa under the rubble Anna Gaidarzhi was a florist designer, decorated weddings, birthdays, loved to create beauty around and give joy to everyone, her older brother Sergei told the Ukrainian media.

According to him, it was a miracle that his son-in-law and daughter survived: that night, by some miraculous circumstance, the husband went to sleep in his daughter’s room.

Rescuers found Anna and tiny Timofey a day after the tragedy. Mother and child will be buried in closed coffins, says Anna’s brother. “Currently, 10 deaths are known, of which three children: Mark, who is not even three years old, Elizaveta, eight months, and Timofey, four months. Ukrainian children are military targets Russia. This is who these monsters are fighting with. My condolences to all the family and friends," said President of Ukraine Vladimir Zelensky.📷N. KulebaSubscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

event: Establishment of Russian Control in Novomikhailovka
description: Russian troops, specifically the 'Storm' detachment of the 155th OGvBrMP, have established control in Novomikhailovka, up to and including the Church of the Miracle of the Archangel Michael. However, Ukrainian forces still hold territory to the west and north, including the school and House of Culture, where fierce battles are ongoing.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
Situation in Novomikhailovka (DPR) In the center of Novomikhailovka, the “Storm” detachment of the 155th OGvBrMP planted two flags of its unit. One is at the personal request of a unit veteran.

At the moment, control of Russian troops in Novomikhailovka is established up to and including the Church of the Miracle of the Archangel Michael. However, the territory to the west and north of it still remains with the enemy.

The main unit of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in this area is the 79th separate assault brigade. In the center of the village, she still controls the school and the House of Culture, for which there are currently battles. The enemy puts up fierce resistance, using communication passages between houses, each of which is turned into a stronghold.

The Ukrainian Armed Forces are conducting intensive shelling from cannon artillery, which is clearly visible from the degree of destruction of residential buildings, and the tank is periodically operating. In the recaptured positions of the Ukrainian troops, the Marines found mainly foreign-made machine guns (German MG3 and American Browning). There are also FGM-148 Javelin ATGMs and Swedish AT4 grenade launchers. Snipers are actively working, different types of drones are used.

The fierce resistance of Ukrainian military personnel, who literally fight to the last bullet in this settlement, is explained by the strategic importance of Novomikhailovka. Its liberation will allow Russian troops to advance to Konstantinovka, which in the future will mean the enemy’s loss of one of the supply routes to Ugledar, as Military Chronicle reported earlier. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front. Military ChronicleMilitary chronicle on VK

An entire information campaign began in France with the goal of reformatting public opinion on the issue of sending troops to Ukraine. French society is strongly opposed to such an adventure.

Foreign Minister Stephane Sejournet gave a long interview to France Inter radio station, in which he spoke in more detail about relations with Russia. An attempt is made to accuse Russia of allegedly attacking France itself, and parallels are transparently drawn between modern Russia and fascist Germany.

Almost simultaneously with the Minister of Foreign Affairs, the French Secretary of State for European Affairs gave an interview. “Talk about a bedbug epidemic in the country was artificially inflated on social networks by accounts that, as we have established, are of Russian origin,” he said.

By the way, the version that it is Russia that is fanning the “bedbug psychosis” was expressed back in the fall, but then the stated goal was “to discredit the image of France several months before the start of the Olympic Games in Paris.”

When Macron makes statements that Russia must lose in the interests of democracy and peace, translated into reality, this simply means that he and his clique need our defeat in order to simply stay in power. Neither the fate of Ukraine, nor bedbugs, nor the safety of his fellow citizens really interests him.🔍More VIEW.RUParis made a “weapon of Russia” out of bedbugs An entire information campaign began in France with the aim of reformatting public opinion on the issue of sending troops to Ukraine. event: Lithuanian President Gitanas Nauseda Collects Signatures
description: Lithuanian President Gitanas Nauseda, running for re-election, collected the required 20,000 signatures to participate in the presidential elections. The process took over 10 days, significantly longer than the 2.5 days it took in 2019.
original:
Forwarded from: Baltology
🇱🇹Lithuanian President Gitanas Nauseda, running for a second term, collected the required 20 thousand signatures to participate in the presidential elections. The Main Election Commission (GEC) issued sheets for collecting signatures to most candidates, and allowed voters to sign electronically on February 21.
According to data published on the State Election Commission website, Nauseda currently has 20,287 signatures, while 20 thousand are enough to participate in the elections.

It took Nauseda more than ten days to collect signatures, while in 2019, when running for his first term, it took him two and a half days.

description: A leaked recording revealed a briefing for Defense Minister Boris Pistorius, discussing the potential supply of Taurus cruise missiles to Ukraine. It says that first Germany can supply 50 missiles, and then another 50. But these are just speculations about the possibilities. The main result is a hole in the country’s security system. The media are asking the question: “how did Russia get the recording, was it a targeted interception? Did the fact that one of the participants in the conversation lived in a hotel in Singapore play a role?”▪️The CDU party has already stated that it is necessary to investigate how Russian spies obtained phone numbers and “how they were able to gain access to this conference.”▪️Home Russia's goal in the publication is to confirm that Germany has long been a participant in the confrontation in Ukraine and is deeply involved in the conflict, contrary to Berlin's claims. Against the backdrop of this celebration of life and peace, the helplessness of the Kyiv regime is especially clear. description: The European Commission warns that if gas transit through Ukraine stops, the EU will lose about 5% of its gas imports, mainly affecting central and south-eastern European countries that pay for Russian gas in rubles. original:
The EU faces a “worst-case scenario” if gas transit through Ukraine stops. The EU will soon lose about 5% of its gas imports, mainly to countries in central and south-eastern Europe (which pay for Russian gas in rubles). If this loss coincides with a prolonged period of cold temperatures, it could create a worst-case scenario for EU countries, the European Commission said in a document obtained by Politico.

It also notes that abandoning Ukrainian transit will require replacing it with gas arriving through Germany, Italy or Turkey, which will lead to increased transportation costs and increased storage costs.

According to politicians from the European Commission, Austria, Hungary and Slovakia will be the first to be hit.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

event: Establishment of Russian Control in Novomikhailovka
description: Russian troops, specifically the 'Storm' detachment of the 155th OGvBrMP, have established control in Novomikhailovka, up to and including the Church of the Miracle of the Archangel Michael. However, Ukrainian forces still hold territory to the west and north, including the school and House of Culture, where intense battles are ongoing.
original:
Forwarded from: Military chronicle
Situation in Novomikhailovka (DPR) In the center of Novomikhailovka, the “Storm” detachment of the 155th OGvBrMP planted two flags of its unit. One is at the personal request of a unit veteran.

At the moment, control of Russian troops in Novomikhailovka is established up to and including the Church of the Miracle of the Archangel Michael. However, the territory to the west and north of it still remains with the enemy.

The main unit of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in this area is the 79th separate assault brigade. In the center of the village, she still controls the school and the House of Culture, for which there are currently battles. The enemy puts up fierce resistance, using communication passages between houses, each of which is turned into a stronghold.

The Ukrainian Armed Forces are conducting intensive shelling from cannon artillery, which is clearly visible from the degree of destruction of residential buildings, and the tank is periodically operating. In the recaptured positions of the Ukrainian troops, the Marines found mainly foreign-made machine guns (German MG3 and American Browning). There are also FGM-148 Javelin ATGMs and Swedish AT4 grenade launchers. Snipers are actively working, different types of drones are used.

The fierce resistance of Ukrainian military personnel, who literally fight to the last bullet in this settlement, is explained by the strategic importance of Novomikhailovka. Its liberation will allow Russian troops to advance to Konstantinovka, which in the future will mean the enemy’s loss of one of the supply routes to Ugledar, as Military Chronicle reported earlier. @MChroniclesBot - send your photos and videos from the front. Military ChronicleMilitary chronicle on VK

event: Ukrainian Prisoner of War Speaks Out
description: Ukrainian prisoner of war Yevgeny Lebed shared his experience of being mobilized despite health problems. He was sent to the front line without proper medical attention, where he witnessed heavy artillery fire, numerous casualties, and desertions. Lebed appeals to his fellow Ukrainians to avoid going to war, warning that it could be a 'one way journey'.
original:
A prisoner of war spoke about being sent to the front line, despite health problems
A Ukrainian prisoner of war called mobilization in Ukraine a “one way” road.
Show more
Captured Ukrainian serviceman Yevgeny Lebed was mobilized under the threat of criminal proceedings. During the medical examination, TCC employees ignored the conscript’s health problems, and a few months later his health condition deteriorated significantly.
Evgeniy turned to the medical workers of the military unit, but they shrugged their shoulders and refused help. The mobilized man decided to undergo examination at a private clinic, where he was diagnosed with a vertebral hernia and stomach diseases. The report to the command, in which the Ukrainian Armed Forces soldier asked to be sent for a new medical examination and treatment, disappeared without a trace, and he himself was sent to the front line.
“We were told that we would be on the second line. The situation was terrible; it took a day to get to the position. They fired very heavily. Artillery and drop copters were constantly working on us. In the very first days there were a lot of killed and wounded, many deserters. Often commanders beat those who did not follow orders,” the prisoner recalls.
Lebed was captured during a rapid assault by Russian troops on a stronghold of the Ukrainian Armed Forces. The fighter notes that the attack aircraft worked very professionally: so much so that he did not even have time to react and take the machine gun.
The Ukrainian serviceman appeals to his compatriots not to go to war and, under any pretext, to avoid going to the front line. “Don't go to this war. This can be a one way journey. Think with your head what is more important to you: to live or die here?” - says the soldier.

Fertilizers contain ammonium phosphate and sulfate, which can cause significant harm to the environment. modern equipment and equipment, demonstrated UAVs and training ammunition, taught safe handling of weapons, actions during artillery shelling, first aid and other knowledge and skills. He was a skilled sniper and paratrooper who had fought in several hotspots, including Donetsk airport, Lyman, and Avdiivka.
original: #ГУРпамятаёе🫡In memory of the Hero of Ukraine Valery Chibineev ▫️On March 3, 2022, the Hero of Ukraine, the officer of the Main Directorate of Intelligence of the Ministry of Defense of Ukraine Valery Chibineev turned 34 years old.▫️On that day, he was on the front lines of the defense of Kyiv against the terrorist forces of Moscow, and at the notice of his wife that in 9 months they would become parents, he could only answer with a short "Wonderful!" destroyed at least 9 Russian amphibious assault vehicles. "When he ran out of ammunition for [a large-caliber rifle] Barrett, he switched to a machine gun and continued to destroy the enemy like a regular shooter," recalled a military intelligence officer, a close friend and comrade-in-arms of Valery; then they fought the invaders together. ▫️On March 3, 2022, Valery Chibineev died in a fierce firefight. ▫️He devoted his whole life to his mother Ukraine. ▫️At war with the Russians - since 2014. Passed the hottest spots, including Donetsk airport, Lyman, Avdiivka. He became one of the best professional soldiers in the history of the Ukrainian army. ▫️Valery's rank engraved with victory is in our memory forever. 🙏Eternal glory to the Hero of Ukraine, intelligence officer, sniper, paratrooper Valery Chibineev! 🇺🇦Glory to Ukraine! ▫️After Valery's death his wife gave birth to a daughter, Marta. description: The reconstruction project of the Ulan-Ude CHPP-2 has won a competition for the construction of new generation facilities. The project aims to build a new 65-megawatt turbine by 2028, increasing the total volume of thermal power and resolving the issue of energy supply to the city.
original:
The reconstruction project of the Ulan-Ude CHPP-2 won the competition for the construction of new generation facilities. The head of the Ministry of Energy of Buryatia, Alexey Tsydenov, clarified that at the CHPP-2, the TGK-14 company will build a new turbine for 65 megawatts by 2028.

The construction of new capacities for electricity and heat generation will increase the total volume of thermal power.

The modernization of CHPP-2 is part of the master plan for the development of Ulan-Ude approved by Russian President Vladimir Putin.

“CHP-2 is undergoing reconstruction, modernization and construction of new generation. This will allow us to resolve the issue of energy supply to the city, increase reliability and additional creation of heat generation capacity,” emphasized Alexey Tsydenov.

Construction of CHPP-2 began in 1983, but due to the collapse of the USSR, the station was not completed and today operates only in boiler room mode.

Although the necessary infrastructure (fuel warehouses, railway access roads, chimney, etc.) has been built. Completion of the construction of Ulan-Ude CHPP-2 with the generation of heat and electricity will help close the shortage of electrical power, which remains one of the main problems of the city.#Buryatia

description: Elon Musk expressed his agreement with the idea that NATO should have been dissolved after the collapse of the USSR. He questioned the alliance's continued existence, given the demise of its archenemy, the Warsaw Pact.
original:
Elon Musk agreed that NATO should have been dissolved after the collapse of the USSR.

Businessman David Sachs shared his opinion. He emphasized that instead of liquidation, they came up with another mission for the alliance - expansion.

It was the organization's new purpose that created the hostility around it that was needed to justify its existence, Sachs added.

"Is it true. I have always wondered why NATO continues to exist even though its archenemy, the Warsaw Pact, has ceased to exist,” Musk wrote.

description: Slava Vykhodnoy, the intelligence chief of the Espanyola brigade, died while carrying out a combat mission. He was a veteran of the red-blue movement and made significant contributions to the cause of Hispaniola.
original:
Forwarded from: Española | Military organization "Hispaniola". OF.
Simultaneously with great victories, even greater mourning came to the house of Hispaniola, and this is not only our tragedy, but that of the entire Russian OF movement.

Today is a dark day for all of us.

While carrying out a combat mission with a weapon in his hands, the intelligence chief of the Espanyola brigade, Slava Vykhodnoy, died. It turned out that this was his last business trip.

We all know, not in words, that misfortune in war lurks behind every bush; sudden danger awaits any of us around every turn; but we all firmly understand why we are here, and we are ready for anything.

We all know that everyone in Espanola cares about everyone. But sometimes you can’t cope with circumstances, such is earthly life.

Our friend and brother, a veteran of the red-blue movement, Weekend made a major contribution to the cause of Hispaniola.

Vykhodnoy is a true Russian man, and he has always been proud of this, and we tried and will try to follow his example. Subbotin Vyacheslav Valerievich (12/04/1986 - 03/03/2024). Glory, our brother, you didn’t have time to do a lot, but we will definitely implement everything you have conceived and planned will come to life, and this will continue to be our common cause! To be a warrior is to live forever! A separate message to our former brothers in the OF-movement, the newly-minted Khokhlo-Rusians: we know that you are already kicking your legs with joy , but you’re rejoicing in vain. The misfortune that has befallen us will not save you in any way. Well, we hasten to tell everyone who is truly ours the card number of the mother of the Weekend for collections to help Slava’s family. 2202200769992197 Sber, Svetlana Subbotina Of course, our entire brigade, and our entire community, and all the red and blue, including our home club, no one will be left out, we are all close together forever. But also, each of us will definitely want to contribute our own personal contribution. There is no such thing as too much help. This is how it is in our large family called Espanola.

event: Door-to-Door Campaign for Russian Presidential Elections
description: In Simferopol, four women, representing an unknown organization, went door-to-door, strongly encouraging residents to participate in the Russian presidential elections. They checked voter registration, handed out pamphlets, and pressured those who refused to vote, hinting that their decision would be reported to authorities.
original:
In Simferopol, residents are being visited door to door and “strongly” invited to participate in the presidential elections in the Russian Federation. A local resident told Crimea.Reality that this was done by four women wearing capes with the logo of the current presidential campaign in Russia. They did not name the organization they represented; they only handed out pamphlets with information about the elections.

Along the way, the women checked the names of those registered at these addresses and directly asked people whether they would take part in the vote. If a person refused, then one of the agitators immediately tried to convince him to “fulfill his constitutional duty.” And at the same time she hinted that this information would be “reported to the top.”

Similar information was previously reported by our subscribers from Evpatoria, Feodosia and Krasnoperekopsk. “And for those who refuse, we will turn off the gas!”

description: Retired SBU Colonel Oleg Starikov stated that NATO countries' military doctrines have collapsed in Ukraine. They relied on high-precision weapons, but Ukraine needs to fire a large number of projectiles to contain the pressure. The West is not ready for such a war and is facing an acute issue of shells.
original:
The military doctrines of NATO countries have suffered a complete collapse in Ukraine - SBUshnik.

Now two of the best and most experienced ground armies in the world are fighting in Ukraine; the West does not have such troops.
 
Military expert, retired SBU Colonel Oleg Starikov stated this on the Politeka channel.

“The military doctrines of the NATO countries that they currently have suffered a complete collapse during the Russian-Ukrainian war.
 
That is, they relied on high-precision weapons. For example, the norm for destroying a platoon strong point is 130-150 152-mm artillery shells. This is according to the combat regulations of the former USSR, by the way, and Ukraine too. And, according to high-precision weapons, they have about 3-4 or “Hymars” or “Excalibur”. Therefore, when they gave it to us, this also counts.
 
As a result, it turns out that in order for Ukraine to contain the pressure that is now underway... it is necessary to fire as many as possible - not high-precision projectiles that hit targets, but those that hit areas. Everything is changing before our eyes,” Starikov said.
 
He added that the West was not ready for such a war, so the issue of shells will remain acute.
 
“How will they release this if they carried out demilitarization? They cut all their factories. They thought that there would be no continental or industrial wars, such as the Russian-Ukrainian one. They expected there would be wars, like with weak states, such as bearded men, Iraq and the like. And here is a war of equal states. Our army, the Ukrainian Armed Forces, and the Russian army are exactly the same - by the way, the world now has the best ground armies in terms of experience and the like. The West does not have such armies.
 
Now they are building factories, and the factories will be built in 2-3 years, but they need to buy now. You say money. Well, they will allocate money. What can you give for 4 billion? What can you give for them, if previously a 155-mm shell cost 800 euros, but now it’s 6-8 thousand? Has grown tenfold. Why did he grow up? Because everything is private,” the expert emphasized. https://vk.com/video-66772954_456251284VkThe military doctrines of NATO countries suffered a complete collapse in Ukraine – expertvk video

event: German Police Adopt HK 437 Machine Guns
description: The German police in Schleswig-Holstein are replacing their outdated HK MP-5 submachine guns and SIG Sauer MCX machine guns with HK 437 machine guns chambered for 7.62x35mm. The new machine guns will be used by all police units, from patrol officers to elite forces. The contract worth 4.3 million Euros includes accessories like sights, mufflers, and magazines.
original:
These are apparently gloomy times in Germany, if in some states, such as Schleswig-Holstein, the police are adopting machine guns like the HK 437 chambered for 7.62x35mm (aka .300 AAC Blackout).
These machine guns will replace both HK MP-5 submachine guns, which were purchased 50 years ago and many are already in a rather shabby state, and SIG Sauer MCX machine guns, which were used mainly by special forces - SEK. According to the police, the SIG Sauer MCX assault rifles had problems due to manufacturing defects, which led to problems during use. Therefore, it was decided to replace them completely. Moreover, the rearmament will be complete - from patrol officers to elite police units - everyone will switch to new machine guns.
A contract was signed for 4.3 million Euros. This price also includes sights, mufflers, magazines, spare parts, flashlights and other accessories.
A total of 1,700 HK 437 assault rifles should arrive by 2026. HK 437 barrel length is 9" and will be standardly equipped with A-TEK silencers
Interestingly, the Bundeswehr also purchased these machine guns for the KSK. They were put into service under the designation G39. Which is somewhat strange for me, given the fact that the KSK adopted the G95 K not so long ago Link to source#pandadialog#pandanews

description: A loyal dog named Balbes, also known as 'The Goonie', sacrificed himself to protect his comrades from a Ukrainian kamikaze drone in the Kherson direction. The dog, who was part of the family, rushed at the drone and grabbed it with his teeth, ultimately giving his life to save others.

Forwarded from: Ukraina.ru
😢The dog died protecting his comrades from a kamikaze drone. The tragic story of the dog Balbes was told by military correspondent Dmitry Zimenkin: Soldier Eric on the front line (Kherson direction) got a dog. She nailed it and became a family member. They called the dog “Dumby.” He was hectic, but loyal and fearless. Noticing that the fighters were running away from kamikaze drones, he clearly regarded this as a threat to his close comrades. And the next time, when another Ukrainian fpv flew into position, people began to run away and hide, and he, “The Goonie,” rushed to protect his own: he rushed at the drone, grabbed it with his teeth...

And he died without allowing the position to be attacked...

Tragic footage shows the last minutes of the life of “The Goonie” (not worth watching for the faint of heart). Fighter Eric lost his friend and became even more bitter towards the enemy. Now he considers it necessary to destroy the enemy with ammunition drops signed in honor of the hero dog.

description: Reindeer Herder Day is celebrated in Kamchatka, where nomadic families gather to socialize and spend time together. The holiday highlights the importance of preserving traditional industries and passing on skills from elders to young people.
original:
Today, on the first Sunday of March, Reindeer Herder Day is celebrated in Kamchatka.

Traditionally, this holiday is an occasion for those who are nomadic throughout the year to gather with their families and neighbors, socialize and spend time together. On the eve of the holiday I was able to meet with some of them. I want to tell you about them too.

Nina Kleonovna Indanova and Liliya Kleonovna Tylkanova are sisters. They grew up in a herd, as their parents were reindeer herders and herded reindeer all their lives. Girls came to the village only when they went to school.

Mark Ilyich Indanov went to work at the Anavgaisky state farm after school, back in the eighties - and worked as a reindeer herder until the dissolution of the state farm.

Vasily Petrovich Adukanov was literally born in the tundra in 1965. Over the years, he has become an indispensable specialist. He now passes on all the reindeer herding skills that he learned from his parents to his young people.

His wife, Klavdia Vladimirovna, also spent her entire life in the herd - first with her parents, and then, after getting married, she worked as a plague worker. The children of Klavdia Vladimirovna and Vasily Petrovich, three sons and a daughter, also grew up in the tundra.

Over tea we talked about everyday life and the development of the industry, what to do to restore the livestock.

The main key to success is the transfer of experience from elders and the involvement of young people in traditional industries. To this end, a law on reindeer husbandry was adopted in Kamchatka last year. Its main provisions, which include additional payments, benefits, and support measures, should be fully operational this year. Which, of course, will help increase the prestige of the reindeer herding professions.

I sincerely congratulate all reindeer herding workers on your holiday. Thank you for your hard but very important work. For preserving the traditions and nature of our native Kamchatka.

Archival photos - from an article by Boris Petrovich Levchuk, archives of the Kamchatka Territory

description: Slava Vykhodnoy, the intelligence chief of the Espanyola brigade, died while carrying out a combat mission. He was a veteran of the red-blue movement and made significant contributions to the cause of Hispaniola.
original:
Forwarded from: Española | Military organization "Hispaniola". OF.
Simultaneously with great victories, even greater mourning came to the house of Hispaniola, and this is not only our tragedy, but that of the entire Russian OF movement.

Today is a dark day for all of us.

While carrying out a combat mission with a weapon in his hands, the intelligence chief of the Espanyola brigade, Slava Vykhodnoy, died. It turned out that this was his last business trip.

We all know, not in words, that misfortune in war lurks behind every bush; sudden danger awaits any of us around every turn; but we all firmly understand why we are here, and we are ready for anything.

We all know that everyone in Espanola cares about everyone. But sometimes you can’t cope with circumstances, such is earthly life.

Our friend and brother, a veteran of the red-blue movement, Weekend made a major contribution to the cause of Hispaniola.

Vykhodnoy is a true Russian man, and he has always been proud of this, and we tried and will try to follow his example. Subbotin Vyacheslav Valerievich (12/04/1986 - 03/03/2024). Glory, our brother, you didn’t have time to do a lot, but we will definitely implement everything you have conceived and planned will come to life, and this will continue to be our common cause! To be a warrior is to live forever! A separate message to our former brothers in the OF-movement, the newly-minted Khokhlo-Rusians: we know that you are already kicking your legs with joy , but you’re rejoicing in vain. The misfortune that has befallen us will not save you in any way. Well, we hasten to tell everyone who is truly ours the card number of the mother of the Weekend for collections to help Slava’s family. 2202200769992197 Sber, Svetlana Subbotina Of course, our entire brigade, and our entire community, and all the red and blue, including our home club, no one will be left out, we are all close together forever. But also, each of us will definitely want to contribute our own personal contribution. There is no such thing as too much help. This is how it is in our large family called Espanola.

description: A sapper with the call sign 'Burning' shared his experience, having previously worked in the fire department. He joined the military to protect his loved ones, not for financial gain. He learned to install various mines and became a sought-after specialist with combat experience.
original:

He says that his wife reacted with understanding to the decision to go to the Northern Military District zone. “I didn’t want to be here solely because I wanted to make money. You don’t even want to walk under fire and through minefields and money... There’s just a desire to protect your loved ones,” says the sapper.
Show more
Upon arrival at the unit, the serviceman was carrying ammunition. Then I learned how to install different mines - tripwires and others. Today he is a sought-after specialist in his field, a sapper with combat experience. “The work of a sapper is very important. Neither infantry nor tanks begin to move without us. It turns out that we are always the first to arrive at the front lines. There is a lot of work,” adds the military engineer.

original: “The transition to Cossack societies from the NGO format to Cossack troops is now being implemented.” On the sidelines of the II Great Cossack Circle of the Russian Cossacks, Don Cossack and political scientist Anton Bredikhin commented on the expected creation of the Cossack troops of the Russian Federation, announced by the ataman of SKVRiZ, deputy commander of the DShK Nikolai Dyakonov. “Since 2005, everyone has been trying to implement the law bring to the same level when the Cossacks enter the path of civil service. But, alas, we do not see significant changes even with the adoption of amendments to this law," Bredikhin recalled. However, now it is necessary to take into account the experience of the participation of the Cossacks in the Northern Military District, the formation of the Cossack reserve and territorial defense, the expert emphasized. He also recalled that Cossack troops have already been put into practice. As an example, he cited the Volunteer Assault Corps with Cossack brigades and separate detachments. “This practice should receive support at the state level and be implemented in a national format,” says Bredikhin. description: Alexander, a Nizhny Novgorod resident, committed a triple murder in 1999, killing two brothers and their relative with a bayonet. He believed they were responsible for his father's death. Alexander then fled with a fake passport and was only caught last year in Kogalym.
original:
Forwarded from: Ni Mash
A Nizhny Novgorod resident was given a life sentence for a triple murder committed 24 years ago. All this time he was hiding in the Urals with a fake passport.

After returning from the army in 1999, Alexander learned that his father Arkady had been killed. Investigators accused the friend, and locals whispered that one of the brothers, the owners of the sawmill in Belasovka, was guilty. They allegedly scammed workers out of their pay. Arkady came to them for money and his chainsaw, but was hit on the head with a bottle. Believing these conversations, Alexander took a bayonet and stabbed the brothers and their relative to death.

After the massacre, Alexander fled with the left passport in the name of Mikhail; the avenger was found only last year in Kogalym. All this time he worked as a parachute jumping instructor in Nizhnevartovsk, even managed to start a family and receive a bunch of certificates. But, despite his merits, he was sentenced to life imprisonment. Subscribe to Ni Mash

event: Lawyer Presents ChatGPT Findings in Court
description: A lawyer in the Cassation Economic Court presented ChatGPT's findings to challenge the judges' verdict in a commercial debt collection case. ChatGPT's interpretation questioned the court's use of 'voluntary commitment', citing it as contradictory to substantive law norms.
original:
A precedent in Ukrainian legal proceedings: a lawyer presented to the court the findings of ChatGPT, which cast doubt on the judges’ verdict.

The incident occurred in the Cassation Economic Court. The case concerned the collection of commercial debt.

A lawyer in one of the cases asked the judges to explain their decision. And he referred to the interpretation made by ChatGPT, which considered the court’s use of the concept of “voluntary commitment” to be incorrect. According to the AI, it “contradicts the theoretical concept enshrined in the norms of substantive law.”

But the court did not appreciate the lawyer’s advancement and on February 8 decided that the lawyer “disregarded the authority of the judiciary.” In addition, the judges said that the use of AI in the legal process has no regulatory regulation and scientifically proven basis.

Only judge Anna Vronskaya expressed a dissenting opinion, who did not see any signs of unfair procedural actions. Therefore, in her opinion, the use of AI cannot be considered an abuse of procedural rights. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

On the contrary, officers discuss possible costs (deaths of civilians) and how to minimize them. That is, nothing like that."No, the most piquant thing is the very fact of the leak. Whether this was naivety, negligence or technical ignorance will now quickly become clear ".Nein, das Brisante ist der Vorgang an sich. Die Bundeswehrführung hat es offenbar versäumt, sicherzustellen, dass solche Gespräche nur über abhörsichere Kanäle stattfinden. description: Russian naval commander Fyodor Ushakov led a squadron to capture the impregnable fortress on the island of Corfu in the Mediterranean Sea. The French garrison of 3,000 soldiers and 650 guns was defeated through a clever plan, involving a blockade, aimed fire from a nearby island, and a simultaneous troop landing. The commandant surrendered, and 2,931 people were captured on honorable terms.
original:
🗓On March 3, 1799, a Russian squadron under the command of the great Russian naval commander Fyodor Ushakov took what was considered an impregnable fortress on the island of Corfu in the Mediterranean Sea.

Revolutionary events in France at the end of the 18th century and the subsequent wars led to the fact that many key points in the Mediterranean Sea, including the Ionian Islands, control over which allowed them to extend their influence to the Balkans, were captured by the French. The Black Sea squadron of Fyodor Ushakov, with the support of a small Turkish flotilla, was tasked with taking control of the Ionian Islands, which were liberated by the beginning of November 1798: during October, the squadron took eight fortresses in battle. All that remained was to accomplish the impossible: to take the impregnable fortifications on the island of Corfu. The French garrison numbered about three thousand soldiers and more than 650 guns. A blockade of the island was organized, which lasted through the winter. At the beginning of March, it was decided to take decisive action. In order to avoid heavy losses during the assault, Ushakov decided to fortify himself on the small mountainous island of Vido and from its heights conduct aimed fire at the enemy, while simultaneously landing troops on Vido and Corfu. The plan worked (in addition, the local population showed safe passages), hand-to-hand combat ensued in the ditches, and by March 3, the commandant of the fortress was forced to lay down his arms.

2,931 people were captured on honorable terms of surrender, including 4 generals. The French were allowed to leave the island with a promise not to participate in hostilities for 18 months.🎖For this assault, Emperor Paul promoted Ushakov to admiral and awarded the diamond badges of the Order of St. Alexander Nevsky, the Neapolitan king - the Order of St. Januarius, 1st degree, and the Ottoman Sultan - a chalenk , Turkey's highest military award.☝️The decisive actions of the great naval commander made it possible to capture the impregnable fortress with minimal losses. Suvorov wrote to Ushakov: “Hurray! To the Russian fleet... Now I say to myself: why wasn’t I at least a midshipman at Corfu.”

event: German Defense Minister Comments on Leaked Recording
description: German Defense Minister Pistorius responded to a leaked recording of German officers discussing scenarios for transferring Taurus missiles to Kyiv. He downplayed the significance of the conversation, attributing its publication to Russia's information war. Pistorius stated that some information shared in the conversation was not intended for public knowledge.
original:
🇩🇪❗️In the published recording, German officers discussed various scenarios - this does not mean a “green light” for the transfer of Taurus missiles to Kyiv, said German Defense Minister Pistorius. According to him, the publication of a conversation between the German military is “part of Russia’s information war.” Apart from the published recording, nothing is currently known about other information leaks.

Germany hopes that the first results of the verification of the conversation will be available early next week, but some of the information voiced during the intercepted conversation was indeed not intended for the general public, Pistorius said.

description: The roof of a hospital garage in Kachkanar, Sverdlovsk region, collapsed, crushing two ambulances. The incident is believed to be caused by the hospital building's lack of repairs and snow accumulation on the roof.

The incident was commented on by the Ministry of Health of the Sverdlovsk Region. Officials said that a meeting of the operational headquarters had already been held at the hospital. They added that the collapsed roof will only begin to be dismantled tomorrow, Monday. original:
In the Sverdlovsk region, the roof of the garage of a city hospital collapsed. Yesterday evening in the city of Kachkanar, a concrete slab collapsed in the Central Hospital. The roof of the garage crushed two of the seven ambulances that were standing in the garage at that moment. The local publication Vecherniye Vedomosti suggests that the roof could have collapsed due to a long lack of repairs and the large amount of snow that fell this winter.

The regional Ministry of Health confirmed the incident. The ministry did not name the cause of the collapse, but said that a meeting of the emergency headquarters was held at the hospital, there were no casualties, and they would begin clearing the rubble only tomorrow. “Ambulances that are not involved in work will be temporarily parked at Gorenergo,” the Ministry of Health said.

description: Sappers and firefighters conducted a safety lesson for Forget-Me-Not students, educating them on the dangers of unexploded ordnance and improvised explosive devices. They demonstrated various booby traps and emphasized the importance of not approaching or touching them, and instead informing an adult or calling 101. Firefighters also taught the children about fire safety and prevention.
original:
Sappers and firefighters conducted a safety lesson for Forget-Me-Not students
War, as we know, is most merciless to children. Due to the curiosity and desire inherent to their age to touch everything, take it apart, and see what’s inside, they become the first
Show more
victims of unexploded ordnance, as well as improvised explosive devices disguised as toys or gadgets.
To protect children from this disaster is the task of adults, including specialists from engineering and sapper units.
Boys and girls looked with curiosity at the people in uniform who were bringing boxes with dummies of explosive devices into the assembly hall. The children were shown different booby traps - from a small red ball that you just want to kick, to a massive anti-tank mine; talked about the principles of their operation;
They urged not to approach such objects under any circumstances, not to touch them, and to inform an adult about your find as quickly as possible or call 101.
Then firefighters from the 1st fire and rescue unit of the city of Lugansk got into action. They told where fires come from, how they can be avoided and what to do if a fire has already broken out.
Representatives of the Ministry of Emergency Situations believe that thanks to such lessons it is possible to reduce accidents involving children to a minimum.
Source: Main Directorate of the Ministry of Emergency Situations of Russia for the LUGANSK PEOPLE’S REPUBLIC

description: A Ukrainian M1 Abrams tank, introduced to the battlefield, was destroyed in the Avdeevsky direction by a crew of ATGMs and RPGs, and then finished off with FPV. The tank, lacking 'uranium armor', was vulnerable to attack. Its size and weight made it slow and difficult to maneuver, making it an easy target for drone operators.
original:
The emergence of the M1 Abrams. Defeat on the battlefield.
A view from our side. HISTORY. From the moment this tank was introduced into the Armed Forces of Ukraine, we could observe “terrible PR.” There are a lot of photos on social networks of him driving somewhere, shooting somewhere. Yes, indeed, the Abrams is one of the three heaviest tanks, with the Merkava Mk.4M in first place.

After this tank began to be delivered to the Ukrainian Armed Forces, everyone wondered in which direction it might jump out. At that time, the hottest place was Zaporozhye, where the enemy lost large quantities of foreign equipment (M2 Bradley, Leopard 2, Challenger 2).
 
Six months have passed. Videos began to appear again, this time showing the direct operation of the tank against the positions of the Russian Armed Forces from a closed firing position. A week later, it was discovered by ZALA scouts in the Avdeevsky direction, where it was soon destroyed, first placed on the gusli by a crew of ATGMs and RPGs, and then finished off with FPV. GOAL. The enemy from the 47th Mechanized Infantry Brigade "Magura" decided to use this equipment is used to intimidate the troops of the Russian Armed Forces. But this is war, and there is no invulnerable equipment here, as our guys proved with the example of the famous tank.
 
We assume that the enemy has an old version of the tank without “uranium armor.” Otherwise we would have had to tinker with him longer. This machine is heavy and slow due to its size. He performed well in the sand, but today there are different conditions, different rules of engagement. Here they will destroy you with a drone for 50,000 rubles, without looking at what the equipment is made of and where it was brought from, and even more so in such dimensions as the Abrams it will be difficult for our FPV operators to miss. HOW DID the M1 Abrams APPEAR ON THE BATTLE FIELD? Stocks of armored vehicles in the warehouses of the Ukrainian Armed Forces are depleted every day. Post-Soviet modernized T-72s have been practically destroyed, and deeply modernized T-64s are not able to compete with modern weapons during battles. RESULT: Having relied on American technology, the enemy again miscalculated; modern warfare dictates new rules.
If this continues, they will soon end. Archangel of Special Forces. Subscribe.

On this day two years ago, Ilya Litvin Hrenau died in the battle for Bucha. Who was he?
 
27-year-old Ilya fought in Donbass since 2014. At the same time, he studied to become a native speaker and began to master a new profession. The company Ilya worked for is related to artificial intelligence.

 "On February 24, he called and said that he had downloaded the latest version of the code and that he was going to war. Maybe I will let the team down, but I can't do otherwise," his colleague recalls the last conversation with Ilya.
 
Ilya was and remains a hero for the brothers from Palk. We remember you, brother. We will take revenge.
