event: Concerns over American Military Presence in Denmark
description: Danish activists have raised concerns about the increasing American military presence in Denmark, citing agreements with Finland, Sweden, and Denmark for the deployment of US troops at bases and ports in Scandinavia. They argue that this presence could lead to Denmark being drawn into geopolitical conflicts, particularly in the Arctic region, and potentially compromise Denmark's defense and security policies.
location: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
original:
Forwarded from: Severyanochka
🇩🇰🇺🇸Here Danish activists became concerned about the American military presence in Denmark.

We are talking about a series of US defense agreements with Finland, Sweden and Denmark on the deployment of American troops at bases and ports in Scandinavia. Of course, with an eye to the military development of the Arctic and counteraction to Russia. Since December last year, various pacifist movements have been holding conferences and seminars on the topic of involving quiet and calm Scandinavia in geopolitical showdowns.

And lately, the theses that are voiced there have become more and more acute. Especially considering that the American presence will only expand.

Here I have pulled out the most interesting, in my opinion, arguments that the Danes use when trying to ask their government about the possible risks of such an aggressive policy. Although this is reminiscent of a voice crying in the wilderness: Up to 36,000 American soldiers are stationed in Germany. At the same time, the German Government, especially in the last two years, has been destroying its economic potential, including depriving itself of access to cheap energy resources due to the abandonment of Nord Stream from Russia. The question is, does the presence of American troops in Germany help the German government make decisions that lead to such results? - writes Line Lauridsen from the organization Tid til Fred. An agreement with the United States would mean a serious violation of two basic principles of Danish defense and security policy: the absence of foreign troops on Danish ground and the absence of nuclear weapons on Danish soil...The US has a policy of never publishing or answering questions about whether it stores nuclear weapons on its military bases. We encountered this, for example, in Greenland, where the United States did not report that it had nuclear weapons at the Thule base, says Tove Jensen, an activist from the Peace Initiative organization. /dkdox.tv/videos/DK24002[26:06]

event: Hiring of African Doctors in Russia
description: Due to a shortage of medical specialists in Russia, clinics are increasingly hiring doctors from Africa. For instance, Abdelmalik Mohamed Arif Abdalla from Sudan works as a therapist at clinic No. 2 in Lytkarino. The Russian government has simplified the hiring process, requiring only confirmation of foreign education compliance and a Russian language check during job interviews.
original:
German cars are being replaced by Chinese ones, Russian doctors are being replaced by African ones. To cope with the acute shortage of specialists, specialists from Africa can increasingly be found in Russian clinics. For example, Abdelmalik Mohamed Arif Abdalla from Sudan works as a therapist at clinic No. 2 in Lytkarino.

As you know, in 2023 the government simplified the conditions for hiring foreign doctors: you only need to confirm the compliance of foreign education with Russian, and candidates’ Russian language is checked only during a job interview.

“The shortage of medical workers in the Russian Federation remains significant - approximately 25-30 thousand doctors and more than 50 thousand nurses and paramedics,” says Guzel Ulumbekova, rector of the Higher School of Health Organization and Management.

According to her, there are only 3.7 doctors per thousand people in Russia, which is 20% less than in Germany, and a third less than in Austria or Norway. Subscribe /Eng Twitter/YouTube /Eng Telegram

Camera, motor and as we agreed before...

This time, too, the hackneyed phrases about “meat assaults” and the unfriendly attitude of local residents of the regions that joined Russia towards the military were not avoided. The only interesting thing is the fictitious story about the “completely burned down headquarters and destroyed personal files” before the start of offensive operations in the area of the settlement. The fighter himself in the video, not on the first try, says that he fought as part of the 382nd separate battalion of the Marine Corps, but for some reason the description mentions the 70th Motorized Rifle Regiment of the Russian Armed Forces. Again, there is no connection, or will we attribute it to the illiteracy of Ukrainian “specialists”?
However, the manual has been written and approved, and the easiest way to show the results of your work is with captured Russian soldiers, forcing them to say the necessary things on camera. A train-exhibition titled 'Strength in Truth' was held in the Moscow Region, featuring military equipment, captured weapons, and propaganda materials. The event showcased the Russian military's capabilities and achievements, including a Bradley infantry fighting vehicle, armored cars, and infantry weapons. Visitors could interact with military personnel, take photographs, and explore the exhibits.
original:
New Kargach🇷🇺⚡️ꙂAlbum, We were with dear KUM at the train-exhibition of the Moscow Region "Strength in Truth". Unfortunately, not everything can be laid out, which is easy... Comment from a friend (more concisely):
1. There was a concert and an official part. The music is not for everyone, but in the background and live it fuels the “carnival” atmosphere.
2. Exhibition carriages of the military branches (+ Airborne Forces + on the history of the Great Patriotic War and dedicated to the Northern Military District and even a little to wars and “color revolutions” before) were 90% packed almost all the time. In one of them, captured weapons were displayed - various AR-15 rifles, a Baba Yaga drone, etc.
3. Of the equipment, in addition to the Bradley (one lady aged about 45 even asked where the “trophy tank” was located and I pointed to platforms with other equipment - that’s how much the American infantry fighting vehicle attracted attention) there were many armored cars. Both on the platforms and on the platform. It was possible to climb onto the one on the platform, including inside. Needless to say, everything was surrounded by children and more, and I couldn’t get into either the mud or the armored personnel carrier.
3.5. BTR-82A, Akhmat 6x6 and Ural-VPK 4x4 were provided by the local 150 MSD. It was also possible to climb into a military police armored vehicle on the other side of the platform.
4. As already mentioned, a lot of goods were exhibited - both ours and trophies. Infantry weapons, including captured Western ATGMs and anti-tank grenade launchers, which could also be grabbed, a downed Fury reconnaissance UAV, enemy uniforms (from clothing sets in MM14 to helmets and armored armor with unloading), and were also very generously presented chevrons, documents, propaganda, textbooks.
4.5. There were stands with stories of SVO heroes and their photographs. The Popular Front (there were many of them here) provided the opportunity to write a letter to a soldier. There was a stand dedicated to Platov. There was also the opportunity to take the most basic courses in tactical medicine (I forgot to do this, but I should have). If you didn’t have enough cafes and restaurants at the station (on the top floor, by the way, there is a themed restaurant serving Cossack cuisine), then you could refresh yourself in the “field kitchen”. Well, of course, the content of the IRP of our army was demonstrated.
5. Of our weapons and equipment there was an exhibition with a mortar, infantrymen and a small selection of everything from the military police, including their MPAP. Of all the rifles that were at the exhibition, we were able to touch only the Yarygin MP-443 Grach Pistol, a heavy thing, even without cartridges. Of course, there were various AKs with some body kit and even PKMs with slats and more.
6. The military personnel (both soldiers and sergeants, as well as officers) were quite friendly, talked about the exhibits, had a good command of the material, and allowed us to take photographs next to them and with weapons, including in their hands.
7. Our propaganda materials, as I understand it, come from the Z files project, to which Jansen was involved. The quality is top notch - you look and the base just screams my respects. There was also a stand for photographs with a picture of a raccoon from Kherson being held by a paratrooper.

In my opinion, the event is good, but it lacks some other attractive component. In many ways, people came for Bradley (myself included).
If there had been a Swedish CV9040, or even a captured T-64 in the damask steel version or something else, there would have been even more people, I think. The largest crowds, of course, will be gathered by NATO MBTs. We are waiting for the Obamas and the second Leopards.
The event in many ways looks like an element of Solntseliky’s election campaign. In my opinion, in this respect it is similar to the “Russia” exhibition at VDNH - “miracles” and wonders are also colorfully displayed.

I am very glad that such an event is being held. Our Ministry can do this - a similar train also ran during the Syrian campaign.
We are waiting for a similar train with a larger number of different trophies.

description: A loyal dog named Dumby, also known as 'The Goonie', sacrificed himself to protect his comrades from a kamikaze drone in the Kherson direction. He grabbed the drone with his teeth, saving the position but ultimately losing his life. His bravery has inspired his handler, Fighter Eric, to seek revenge against the enemy.
original:
The dog died protecting his comrades from a kamikaze drone. Soldier Eric on the front line (Kherson direction) got a dog. She nailed it and became a family member. They called the dog “Dumby.” He was hectic, but loyal and fearless. Noticing that the fighters were running away from kamikaze drones, he clearly regarded this as a threat to his close comrades. And the next time, when another Ukrainian fpv flew into position, people started
Show more
run up and hide, and he, “The Goonie,” rushed to protect his own: he rushed at the drone, grabbed it with his teeth... And died, not allowing the position to be attacked... The tragic footage shows the last minutes of the “Goonie’s” life (the faint of heart should not watch ). Fighter Eric lost his friend and became even more bitter towards the enemy. Now he considers it necessary to destroy the enemy with ammunition drops signed in honor of the hero dog. During the Great Patriotic War, animals showed an example of service worthy of admiration, probably without realizing it, but they performed real feats. There is even a practice in the world of awarding animals for such merits with medals and orders. For example, the dog Dzhulbars, who served in the 14th assault engineer brigade (1944 - 1945) and was able to help clear 7.5 thousand mines. Awarded the medal "For Military Merit". Was injured. And that’s why I couldn’t walk in the Victory Parade on Red Square. But upon learning of this, Stalin ordered the dog to be carried in his arms on his overcoat. I think that the faithful “Dumb”, who died in the Northern Military District, is worthy of at least our fond memory of him. Tell your friends about this feat.
Dmitry Zimenkin

event: Illegal Sale of Basement and Demolition of Load-Bearing Wall
description: The council of a 14-entrance house on Plyushchikha Street in Moscow illegally sold the basement to private hands, who are renovating it into warehouses. The demolition of the load-bearing wall and concrete floors has left the building at risk of collapse, causing fear among residents.
original:
The council of the house illegally sold the basement in the center of Moscow for a warehouse - would-be contractors demolished the load-bearing wall there, punched a huge hole and broke the concrete floors, locals are afraid of complete destruction of the building. The 14-entrance house on Plyushchikha Street was left without a load-bearing wall at its very base, Readovka residents said. They recently learned that their basement, which was in common ownership of the apartment owners, was illegally sold by the building council into private hands - now it is being renovated to equip warehouses, and at the same time, the load-bearing walls and concrete floors were demolished and a huge hole was made into the first floor. The fact is that none of the residents knew about the sale, although the council had to agree on this fact with the apartment owners.

The management company of the State Budgetary Institution "EVAZhD" initially assured Readovka that it had not found any damage to the load-bearing structures during the inspection, and then in a new letter stated that it was completely impossible to carry out the inspection. Meanwhile, the capital's prosecutor's office told Readovka that a week later the Criminal Code nevertheless inspected the basement and confirmed the fact of its redevelopment, and also suspended repair work. Residents of the house called the police to the scene and wrote a statement - now the district police officer and the prosecutor's office are looking into the issue. Illegal migrant workers were found in the area, and law enforcement officers will also deal with them. “People, we will collapse or burn” - this is how local residents describe what is happening, who heard the explosions of cylinders during welding work in the basement and the drunken brawl of construction workers. In addition to the collapse of the house, where Now the floor of the first floor has been breached and the load-bearing wall has been damaged. Locals fear that now, if a threat arises, they will have nowhere to quickly hide—according to them, the basement should become a bomb shelter. Now they are going to take it back into their own hands.

Thousands of people came to the Borisov cemetery to honor the memory of Alexei Navalny. At the politician’s grave, a mountain of flowers as tall as a man On March 3, so many flowers were brought to the grave of Alexei Navalny at the Borisov Cemetery in Moscow that they completely covered the wooden cross installed at the burial (its height is usually about 1.7 meters).

People brought flowers to Navalny's grave all day. The line stretched for several hundred meters, although the cemetery security demanded that those who came spend only as much time at the politician’s grave as was necessary to lay flowers.

At 17:00 Moscow time the entrance to the cemetery was closed, but not everyone who came to honor Navalny’s memory left. Meduza readers reported that dozens of people remained at the entrance. They demanded to be allowed inside, chanted “Navalny” and threw flowers over the fence.

event: Dog Sacrifices Life to Save Soldiers
description: A loyal dog named Dooby, who befriended soldiers on the front line, sacrificed his life to save them from an FPV drone. When the drone approached, Dooby rushed to defend his comrades, grabbing it with his teeth and ultimately giving his life to prevent an attack on their position.
original:
18+ Not for the faint of heart.

The dog gave his life saving our soldiers from an FPV drone.

A dog came to the soldiers on the front line; they called him “Dooby”; he was a loyal and fearless friend.

Noticing that the fighters were running away from kamikaze drones, he clearly regarded this as a threat to his close comrades. And the next time, when another Khokhlyat drone flew into the position, the soldiers began to run away and hide, and he, “Dooby,” rushed to defend his own: he rushed at the drone, grabbed it with his teeth and died, not allowing the position to be attacked.

description: Ukrainian journalists uncovered a loophole in sanctions, where Russian agricultural products are being transported from Russia to Poland, then reloaded onto Polish trucks to continue their journey west. This bypassing of sanctions has resulted in significant losses for Ukraine, with February's border blockade by Poland amounting to 8 billion hryvnia (approximately 19 billion rubles).
original:
Investigation by Ukrainian journalists: while Ukrainian truck carriers are blocked at the Polish border, hundreds of trucks are driving non-stop between Poland and Belarus.

What is most offensive for Ukrainians is that we are talking about Russian agricultural products. A truck from Russia reaches the border with Poland, where the goods are loaded onto a Polish truck (due to sanctions, direct transportation has been stopped) and travels further to the west.

According to the figures cited in the Verkhovna Rada, in February, losses from the border blockade by the Poles amounted to 8 billion hryvnia (approximately 19 billion rubles).

event: Presentation of State Awards and Housing Documents
description: Lieutenant General Yuri Bobrov presented state awards, certificates, and military ranks to SVO participants at the Military Medical Academy. The Minister of Defense, Army General Sergei Shoigu, expressed gratitude for their courage and bravery. The event also included the presentation of housing documents to military personnel, ensuring their further military service.
original:
03.03.24. Note from the Russian Ministry of Defense.
"
SVO participants were presented with state awards and documents for housing
In the rehabilitation and educational center operating on the basis
Show more
"Military Medical Academy named after S. M. Kirov", Deputy Head of the Main Personnel Directorate of the Ministry of Defense of the Russian Federation, Lieutenant General Yuri Bobrov presented state awards, certificates of completion of additional professional education courses and military ranks to the participants of the Military Medical Academy.
Lieutenant General Yuri Bobrov conveyed to the military personnel words of gratitude from the Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation, Army General Sergei Shoigu, for the courage, bravery and courage shown in the performance of military duty.
The Minister of Defense of the Russian Federation decided to ensure the possibility of further military service for all military personnel who were wounded during the SVO.
The event was also attended by the deputy head of the “Western” branch of the Federal State Autonomous Institution “Roszhilkompleks” Alexander Novikov, who presented housing documents to the military personnel.
“For military personnel who decided to continue military service after treatment, rehabilitation and professional retraining, housing specialists have already selected and prepared places of residence in selected regions of the country,” emphasized Alexander Novikov.
The head of the Military Medical Academy, Lieutenant General of the Medical Service Evgeniy Kryukov spoke about the program for further rehabilitation of military personnel and medical support at new places of military service.”

description: A Russian consulate employee in Hamburg assaulted a woman who tried to stop him from destroying a Navalny memorial. The woman suffered injuries, including bruises, abrasions, and a head injury, after being dragged along the asphalt.
original:
🤯Russian diplomacy in action: an employee of the Russian consulate in Hamburg dragged a Russian woman along the asphalt when she tried to stop him from destroying the Navalny memorial. The woman has injuries from the blow, bruises, abrasions. According to Hamburg resident Natalia Freudenberg, this happened on March 1, the day of the funeral. She came to lay flowers and light a candle in front of the Consulate General building. It has not been working since the beginning of the year, but there is some technical staff in the building.

The woman saw a man in a work uniform come out of the consulate with a large garbage bag and began wrestling with the flowers. “I take the bag, and he starts to pull it. He raises his hand with the package that I am holding on to, and then sharply lowers it down so that I fall and scream in pain. He dragged me along the asphalt. I couldn’t do anything and let go of the package.” As a result, the man returned to the consulate and threw the flowers in the trash. The woman says she received “injuries from the blow, bruises to the knee, abrasions to the elbow, arm, hand,” and hit her head hard.

description: A public meeting, 'Ukraine: Resist Existence', was held in Udine, Italy, to discuss the importance of Western allies supporting Ukraine with weapons in defense of international law and a just world. The meeting also addressed the issue of disinformation spread by Italian media about the war in Ukraine and Russian propaganda in Italy.
original:
On Saturday, March 2, 2024, a public meeting was held in Udine dedicated to the continuity of Ukrainian resistance to Russian aggression, entitled “Ukraine: Resist Existence,” organized by the associations “Ukraine-Friuli”, “Free Behind Illusions”, the UNESCO Club of Udine with the heritage of the municipality of Udine. They talked about the importance of Western allies supporting Ukraine with weapons in defense of international law and a just world for Ukraine. Another very important aspect was touched upon, such as the alarming disinformation spread by the Italian media about the war in Ukraine and Russian propaganda in Italy.
We sincerely thank all the speakers: Mario Corti Gastone Breccia Eugenia Benigni Viktoria Skyba and everyone who attended our meeting. Thanks to Mario Corti for the book "Ukraine and the Window of Distortions", published on Gaspari Editore in Udine, which talks about disinformation about the ongoing war. In April we will organize a series of presentations of his book in Friuli.

original:
The delay in the negotiation process for a peaceful settlement in Ukraine is worsening the situation in Kyiv. This was stated by Hungarian Foreign Minister Peter Szijjártó.

In recent weeks and months, he said, Russia's success on the battlefield has become clear to everyone. "I've been hearing for months that the Ukrainians could improve their position on the battlefield, which would give them the opportunity to enter negotiations from a better position. In recent weeks it became clear that this scenario had failed, time is on Russia’s side,” Szijjártó said. Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: Firefighters in DPR Provided with Bulletproof Vests
description: Fire and rescue units in the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) were equipped with bulletproof vests to ensure their safety during potential shelling by Ukrainian forces. This measure was taken due to the high risk of attacks, which have resulted in the deaths of 26 Ministry of Emergency Situations employees since 2014.
original:
Kostrubitsky said that firefighters in the DPR were provided with bulletproof vests in case of shelling by the Ukrainian Armed Forces

Fire and rescue units in the DPR were provided with bulletproof vests in case of shelling by Ukrainian troops. The head of the main department of the Ministry of Emergency Situations for the Republic, Alexey Kostrubitsky, told the Donetsk News Agency about this.

“We dressed our workers in bulletproof vests for safety; probably, none of the fire and rescue departments have to put out fires wearing bulletproof vests. This is a new reality in our conditions,” Kostrubitsky noted.

It was previously reported that twenty-six employees of the Ministry of Emergency Situations have died in the DPR since 2014 due to shelling by Ukrainian militants.@gorlovka6tv

event: Heroic Sacrifice of Goofy the Dog
description: Goofy, a fighting dog, gave his life to save his comrades from a Ukrainian FPV drone. The dog, nicknamed 'Booby', intercepted the drone, grabbing it with his teeth, which detonated, saving the Russian soldiers' position.
original:
18+ A fighting dog named Goofy gave his life to save his comrades from a Ukrainian FPV drone,
The dog is reported to have died
attacking an enemy drone that was spotted on Russian army positions.
Show more
Military correspondent Dmitry Zimenkin told about this tragic story.
According to the military correspondent, the dog joined the soldiers of the Russian Armed Forces fighting in the Kherson direction.
Very soon our guys called him “Booby” for his character.
Over time, the dog became our guys' favorite, reciprocating the affection.
According to Telegram channels, the life of a front-line friend of Russian soldiers ended suddenly - the dog died like a real hero.
A kamikaze drone flew into the position of our fighters.
Noticing that our soldiers began to seek shelter from the Ukrainian “bird,” Balbes decided to protect his comrades and rushed to intercept the Ukrainian Armed Forces’ drone.
Having caught up with the drone, the faithful friend of our fighters grabbed the drone with his teeth,
which immediately detonated.
The dog died, preventing him from attacking the position,” the message says.
With this act, Dunce saved our guys.
The footage shows the last tragic minutes of the brave dog’s life.
Thank you for your service, Goofy!

event: Establishment of Russian Control in Novomikhailovka
description: The 'Storm' detachment of the 155th OGvBrMP has established control of Russian troops in Novomikhailovka, up to and including the Church of the Miracle of the Archangel Michael. However, the territory to the west and north remains under Ukrainian control.
original:
The situation in Novomikhailovka (DPR) as reported by Military Chronicle In the center of Novomikhailovka, the “Storm” detachment of the 155th OGvBrMP planted two flags of its unit. One is at the personal request of a unit veteran.

At the moment, control of Russian troops in Novomikhailovka is established up to and including the Church of the Miracle of the Archangel Michael. However, the territory to the west and north of it still remains with the enemy.

The main unit of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in this area is the 79th separate assault brigade. In the center of the village, she still controls the school and the House of Culture, for which there are currently battles. The enemy puts up fierce resistance, using communication passages between houses, each of which is turned into a stronghold.

description: Moldovan President Maia Sandu warns of a potential electricity shortage if Ukraine refuses to transit Russian gas, as Moldova's energy production relies on Russian resources. Currently, Transnistria provides Moldova with electricity produced using inexpensive Russian gas. Alternative options are being considered, including purchasing electricity from Ukraine or Romania, but these solutions may take time to implement.
original: Sandu: Moldova may face a shortage of electricity Moldova will face a shortage of electricity if Ukraine refuses the transit of Russian gas, since its production depends on energy resources from Russia, says the President of the Republic Maia Sandu. - According to the information that I have, there is no final decision on the cessation transit of Russian gas through the territory of Ukraine. Accordingly, it is impossible to say whether there will be transit or not. We have where to buy gas, the only question is its price, but there will be a problem with electricity,” Sandu said on a private TV channel, writes mybusiness.md. According to her, today Transnistria provides Moldova with electricity, which is produced using inexpensive Russian gas. If it is impossible to use it due to the cessation of transit and the purchase of fuel from alternative sources, then Chisinau will have to look for new ways to obtain electricity. Today, the authorities are considering two main options. “Romania cannot yet ensure the operability of the Moldovan energy system, the authorities are working on this, but it will take about a year and a half... I hope that we will be able to return to purchasing electricity from Ukraine,” Sandu added, noting that they can Other options should also be considered. Since December 2022, the Moldovagaz enterprise has been receiving gas from two sources - from the state enterprise Energocom and the Russian Gazprom. Chisinau gives Tiraspol all the gas received from the Russian Federation in exchange for electricity, and itself uses reserves. Owned by the Russian company Inter RAO, the Moldavian State District Power Plant provides Chisinau with more than 80% of the volume that Moldovan consumers need. https://t.me/aifmd
